task_summary: Drive forward down the corridor and reach the designated goal location ahead, then confirm arrival using a position check.

task_long_description.overview: A mobile robot navigates a hallway that features white wall panels, a central wooden door section, and a dark carpeted floor. The objective is to advance toward a predefined goal located ahead along the corridor and validate arrival. The scene shows progressive forward motion and increasing proximity to the door/panel area, consistent with straightâ€‘line navigation. The behavior emphasizes a simple precheck, a goal-directed navigate action with a bounded timeout, and a final verification step to declare success.
preconditions: Goal location 'goal' is defined in the map or localization frame.
Robot has sufficient localization to evaluate IsAt('goal').
Path ahead is traversable with no hard occlusions.
stepwise_plan: Check whether the robot is already at the 'goal' location.
If not at goal, execute NavigateToNamed to move toward 'goal' with nominal yaw.
Upon motion completion, verify arrival with a second IsAt check.
success_criteria: Final IsAt('goal') condition evaluates to true.
Navigation action returns success without timeout or collision events.
failure_and_recovery: If navigation times out, reattempt motion after briefly reassessing localization.
If localization uncertainty is detected, pause and re-localize before retrying.
If an obstacle is encountered, stop and request a replanned route.
task_long_description.termination: Return SUCCESS when the post-navigation IsAt('goal') condition holds; otherwise return FAILURE on timeout or unrecoverable navigation error.

frame_6.now_evidence: Closest pre-arrival view with strong alignment to the goal direction.
frame_6.predicts_next: A final verify check is likely to follow if motion completes.

frame_5.now_evidence: Significant forward progress and centralization of the door/panel cue.

frame_3.now_evidence: Mid-trajectory alignment confirms straight corridor motion.

node_specs.description: Checks whether the robot is currently at the named goal location.
Drives the robot to the named location with the specified yaw and timeout.

failure_modes: Timeout during NavigateToNamed due to blockage or poor localization
Drift causing IsAt('goal') to fail after motion
recovery_strategy: Retry navigation with a fresh path after brief localization update
Reduce speed and re-align heading if lateral drift is detected
Stop and wait before attempting a safe re-route
assumptions: Frames depict a straight corridor advance toward a door/panel region; the 'goal' is ahead along the same heading.
No explicit speed or precision was stated; default timeout and yaw are used.

expected_success_criteria: Post-action IsAt('goal') returns true and navigation reports success
